etymologies: late 19th century. From scientific Latin Fulgora, genus name (LinnaeusSyst. Nat (ed. 12, 1767) I. 703; from classical Latin Fulgora, the name of the Roman goddess of lightning from fulgur lightning) + -id, after Fulgoridae, family name

definitions: A true bug of the hemipterous family Fulgoridae, which comprises many brightly coloured tropical forms that include the lantern flies.
Of or relating to the family Fulgoridae.
